relevent_life_history_and_precipitants: Has a pattern of nurturing and caring roles which are depth of chosen professional path; positive experiences and confidence in past nursing activities and academic settings.
core_beliefs: I'm not smart enough and I can't trust my brain.
intermediate_beliefs: I must understand everything 100% to be considered smart
I can't show any signs of not knowing, or people will think I'm not intelligent
intermediate_beliefs_during_depression: When I can't remember something, it means I'm not bright
If I stumble or pause, it shows my incompetence
coping_strategies: Avoiding mathematical responsibility or tasks that could expose perceived incompetence, seeking reassurance through over-clarification, laughing off personal doubts.

behavioral_models.situation: Offered to give a speech or engage in social interactions
behavioral_models.automatic_thoughts: I'm going to mess up and people will see that I am incompetent
behavioral_models.meaning_of_at: Making a mistake will confirm my lack of intelligence
behavioral_models.behavior: Preparation with some avoidance, seeking validation through performance despite apprehension

behavioral_models.situation: Asked to tutor someone in math or engage in activities involving memory
behavioral_models.automatic_thoughts: I can't remember well enough or I never understood it well to begin with
behavioral_models.meaning_of_at: My brain doesn't work well and I can't trust it
behavioral_models.behavior: Reluctance to charge for tutoring, even if competent; refusal to believe in personal capability

behavioral_models.situation: Required to comprehend reading material or understand new concepts
behavioral_models.automatic_thoughts: I won't grasp this or I’ll forget it soon after
behavioral_models.meaning_of_at: Not understanding or retaining everything reflects on my overall intelligence
behavioral_models.behavior: Routinely checking the dictionary for understanding, second-guessing herself
